content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Discover three new and popular open-source NLP models for language translation released in the past month on Huggingface.  Please interact with https://huggingface.co/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find new and popular open-source NLP models for language translation, I should filter or search models specifically for "Translation." The right panel under "Tasks" lists "Translation" as an option in the "Natural Language Processing" section. Clicking this will likely take me to relevant models.
Action: Click [Translation]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The previous action was invalid because there is no direct numerical label for "Translation." I should use the search bar to look for new NLP translation models, as this will allow me to further refine results based on release date and popularity.
Action: Type [1]; translation
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have identified one new translation model ("Tri-1.8B-Translation") released by Trillion Labs. To discover two more new and popular open-source NLP translation models released in the past month, I need to browse or filter more models on Huggingface.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.33
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search query for "translation" is already in the search bar. I need to execute the search so that I can view a list of translation models to find more new and popular ones.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.33
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search didn’t execute, and instead, a dropdown menu appeared. To move forward, I should try a different way to see a full list of translation models. "Browse 1M+ models" is likely the right way to enter the models exploration page, where I can set filters for newness and translation tasks.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the newest translation models, I need to filter models by the translation task. The "Tasks" button [12] at the top will allow me to choose "Translation," restricting results to relevant models.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Translation task is not immediately visible; filters are open for task selection. There may be more task options in the list or hidden. Clicking the "+ 42" button likely reveals additional tasks including "Translation." 
Action: Click [25]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current filter is set to "Depth Estimation" models, but I need to look for translation models. I should remove this filter by clicking "Reset Tasks" to go back to the main tasks list, then look for "Translation" in the list.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back to the full filter panel, but the "Translation" task is not visible in the current task categories. Since there are multiple NLP tasks, and "Filter Tasks by name" is available, I should use the filter box to search for "Translation" to quickly access the correct task.
Action: Type [17]; Translation
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5

Thought: The "Translation" task under "Natural Language Processing" is now visible. Selecting it will filter the models to only show translation models so I can then sort by new/popular and identify the most recent ones.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6

content:
Thought: The list now shows translation models. To get the most recent ones from the past month, I'll focus on those "updated" within days or hours. The top two models (tencent/Hunyuan-MT-7B and LiquidAI/LFM2-350M-ENJP-MT) are within the last 2 days and 12 hours. I need to scroll down to find another new translation model updated within the past month, ensuring three new and popular models.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7

- LiquidAI/LFM2-350M-ENJP-MT (about 12 hours ago)
- tencent/Hunyuan-MT-7B (2 days ago)
- yanolja/YanoljaNEXT-Rosetta-20B (13 days ago)

2. LiquidAI/LFM2-350M-ENJP-MT (updated about 12 hours ago, 433 downloads, 41 likes)
3. yanolja/YanoljaNEXT-Rosetta-20B (updated 13 days ago, 385 downloads, 24 likes)
These models are open-source NLP models for translation, recently released or updated within the past month and are relatively popular on Huggingface.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
